Auto Updates

Automatic updates via S3 storage with platform-specific installers.

Quick Overview ‚Äã

Snaplark is a cross-platform desktop application built with Electron that enables users to:

  • Capture screenshots with pixel-perfect precision
  • Record screen videos with webcam and audio
  • Annotate captures with professional drawing tools
  • Upload media to the cloud instantly
  • Share captures via generated links

Current Version ‚Äã

  • Version: 1.1.4
  • Platforms: macOS (ARM64, x64), Windows (x64, ia32), Linux (deb, rpm)
  • Framework: Electron 38.3.0

Key Technologies ‚Äã

TechnologyPurpose
ElectronCross-platform desktop framework
Vue 3UI framework with Composition API
PiniaState management
Konva.jsCanvas drawing and annotation
Tesseract.jsOCR text extraction
Tailwind CSSStyling framework
ViteBuild tool and dev server
Electron ForgeBuild, package, and publish

Documentation Structure ‚Äã

This documentation is organized into four main sections:

  1. Guide - Getting started, project structure, and technology stack
  2. Features - Detailed explanation of each feature
  3. Architecture - Technical architecture and code organization
  4. Deployment - Build, signing, publishing, and updates

For New Developers ‚Äã

If you're new to this project, we recommend reading in this order:

  1. Getting Started - Setup and run the project
  2. Project Structure - Understand the codebase layout
  3. Architecture Overview - Understand how components interact
  4. IPC Communication - Learn the main-renderer bridge

For Non-Technical Readers ‚Äã

If you want to understand what the app does without diving into code:

  1. Screenshot Capture - How screenshot capture works
  2. Video Recording - How video recording works
  3. Cloud Upload - How uploads are handled
  4. Auto Updates - How updates reach users
